TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BitmapSizeOptions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines size-related attributes of a cached bitmap image. A bitmap is scaled based on values that are defined by this class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions FromEmptyOptions() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of with empty sizing properties.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions> will have its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.Rotation%2A> property set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation.Rotate0>, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PreservesAspectRatio%2A> set to `true`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> set to zero, and its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.PixelWidth%2A> set to zero.
When passed to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap>, the input is the same as the output.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions FromHeight(int32 pixelHeight) cil managed

Docs.param: The height, in pixels, of the resulting bitmap.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of that preserves the aspect ratio of the source bitmap and specifies an initial .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions> will have its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.Rotation%2A> property set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation.Rotate0>, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PreservesAspectRatio%2A> set to `true`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> set to the value of `pixelHeight`, and its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.PixelWidth%2A> set to zero.

Docs.exception: Occurs when is less than zero.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions FromRotation(valuetype System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation rotation) cil managed

Docs.param: The initial rotation value to apply. Only 90 degree increments are supported.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of that preserves the aspect ratio of the source bitmap and specifies an initial to apply.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The resulting bitmap maintains its original aspect ratio and sizing.
The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions> will have its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.Rotation%2A> property set to the value of `rotation`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PreservesAspectRatio%2A> set to `true`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> set to 0, and its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.PixelWidth%2A> set to 0.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions FromWidth(int32 pixelWidth) cil managed

Docs.param: The width, in pixels, of the resulting bitmap.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of that preserves the aspect ratio of the source bitmap and specifies an initial .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions> will have its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.Rotation%2A> property set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation.Rotate0>, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PreservesAspectRatio%2A> set to `true`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> set to zero, and its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.PixelWidth%2A> set to the value of `pixelWidth`.

Docs.exception: Occurs when is less than zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions FromWidthAndHeight (int pixelWidth, int pixelHeight);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions FromWidthAndHeight(int32 pixelWidth, int32 pixelHeight) cil managed

Docs.param: The width, in pixels, of the resulting bitmap.
The height, in pixels, of the resulting bitmap.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of that does not preserve the original bitmap aspect ratio.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The resulting bitmap has an effective size of `pixelHeight` Ã— `pixelWidth`.
The returned <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions> will have its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.Rotation%2A> property set to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation.Rotate0>, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PreservesAspectRatio%2A> set to `false`, its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> set to the value of `pixelHeight`, and its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.PixelWidth%2A> set to the value of `pixelWidth`.

Docs.exception: Occurs when is less than zero.

Docs.summary: The height, in pixels, of the bitmap image.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> must be greater than zero to be valid.

Docs.summary: The width, in pixels, of the bitmap image.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelWidth%2A> must be greater than zero to be valid.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that determines whether the aspect ratio of the original bitmap image is preserved.
Docs.value: if the original aspect ratio is maintained; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the original aspect ratio is preserved, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> represent the maximum size values for the bitmap. The resulting bitmap is only guaranteed to have either its width or its height match the specified values. If the aspect ratio is not preserved, the specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSizeOptions.PixelHeight%2A> are both used, and the bitmap is stretched to use those values.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that represents the rotation angle that is applied to a bitmap.
Docs.value: The rotation angle that is applied to the image.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Only increments of 90 degrees are supported.
